habitat_description:
The current range for the Mangrove Fox Squirrel includes Immokalee Rise, Big Cypress Swamp, and Devil's Garden areas of Lee, Hendry, Collier, Monroe, and extreme western Dade counties in southwestern Florida, south of the Caloosahatchee River and west of the Everglades; disjunct from other subspecies of fox squirrels (Humphrey and Jodice 1992)(NatureServe 2013). In
southern Florida, they occur in tropical hardwoods and live oak (Q.  virginiana), and less commonly in cypress (Taxodium) swamps and mangrove forests (Humphrey and Jodice 1992, Trani et al. 2007). Williams and Humphrey (1979) report this subspecies as being most abundant in bald cypress-slash pine savannas and the interface between the two (Edwards et al. 2003).
